text.p: Wall Street Stocks were expected to open mixed Friday, capping a week of strong volatility amid a slew of benign key inflation data.
Volume on the opening was expected to be brisk due to block trades from Thursday's closing futures, analysts said. Volume on the close was also set to be strong.
"In between we are just looking at a Friday in August and I see a bit of a void," said analyst Larry Wachtel of Prudential Securities.
S&P 500 futures were flat at 928.05 points. On Thursday U.S. stocks closed with slender gains after a second straight session saw a sharp early rally fizzle in the face of nervous selling pressure.
The Dow Industrials closed Thursday up 13.71 points at 7,942.03. In the broader market the advancing issues led declines 1,516 to 1,258 on heavy volume of 530 million shares.
Analysts said the Dow still needed to consolidate after its strong run up in recent weeks despite the current good outlook for inflation.
The long bond was off 5/32 to yield 6.56 percent.
